intro: Physochlaina physaloides, commonly known as the balloon flower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that resemble small balloons. The plant produces violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release its seeds when mature.
